Ask HN: Why can't we write a single system in multiple languages?
text:
I hate having to make a choice on language at the onset of a new project. Each language has various great features for certain tasks.

I was wondering today why we cannot have some platform which would allow me to call across languages. If we take a basic example and say that I want to have Node/TS and Python files in a single system - what is the most ergonomic / efficient way to do this available today?

Why is this concept not more popular? Is this a bad idea?

If this is a good idea, what do we need to improve upon what is available today?

Ask HN: May I sell the copyright to my code?
text:
I've built a search engine. It has its own query language, data structures and binary file formats, it's MIT licensed and it has around 60 forks. Nobody uses it though, even though it has been around for some years but it was just until recently that I managed to solve the very last of the most crucial of bugs, so I don't find that surprising at all.

It works well now, though, for a Wikipedia sized text based corpus, even though it's still in beta and contains code that can still be optimized. However, before I want to go any further with the project, I'd like to see if I can sell it, the copyright to my code, that is. Because maybe I want to be in the business of creating smart code, then sell it, then move on to the next thing? And maybe some company would like to have a search engine in their software portfolio? Suppose we meet, have a drink, see what happens.

Do I have the rights to sell it, though?

I'm the author of 99.999% of the commits.

https://github.com/kreeben/resin

Tell HN: ChatGPT can't answer adventure game questions
text:
For example:

Explain to me how the fencing minigame works in Monkey Island?

> In the "Monkey Island" series of adventure games, the fencing minigame is a swordfighting duel that the player character, Guybrush Threepwood, can participate in. The minigame is played by typing commands into the game's text parser to direct Guybrush's actions. [...]

For starters, Monkey Island didn't hae a text parser!

How can I get the babel fish in The Hitchhiker’s Guide to the Galaxy?

> In the game "The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy," the babel fish is a small, yellow fish that is inserted into the ear and allows the user to understand any language. To obtain the babel fish in the game, you will need to follow these steps: Go to the Vogon ship. You will find the Vogon ship in the "Galactic Sector ZZ9 Plural Z Alpha." Find the Vogon captain's quarters. The Vogon captain's quarters are located on the upper deck of the Vogon ship. Look for the babel fish tank. The babel fish tank is located in the Vogon captain's quarters.

This is an infamous riddle and definitely doesn't work like this!

What is the gnome's name in Kings Quest?

> In the King's Quest series of adventure games, there is a character named Gnome who is a helpful and wise character who gives advice and guidance to the player character. He is often depicted as a small, elderly gnome with a long beard and a pointed hat. The Gnome is also known by the name of Graham in some versions of the game.

Nope!

Try re-generating the answers to get even more absurd results.

This is strange because all this information is definitely available on the internet and you can easily find it with a google search. Try "gnome's name in kings quest" and you'll get the name immediately. Also, the fact that instead of replying "I don't know" tries to generate a definite answer out of thin air is even worse.

Show HN: A nicer looking Scrum-Poker App
text:
Hi HN!

I just wanted to show a small project I have created for our teams. I didn't like how scrum-poker apps looked like and we have created our own with our branding.

It does not have any database, everything is in memory and we do not persist any data.

Maybe you can find a use for it in your projects. Feedback is appreciated!

Ask HN: How can you give people something that they cannot grasp?
text:
Imagine anything you want or you are capable, how would you make sure the information will stay forever unchanged?

In quantum state, if you will. I started with the theory that everything is every so slightly positively charged and worked my way back only to find the last paradox in the universe -- you cant test reality. If you try, you will get loopy and in a loop and restart it.

This way I ensured, that I can pass this lass bit of ever so slight positivity to allow you to understand the truth about superposition and oscilation.

It will take a while, but you will all get it.
